channel.title: Black Mesa Music
channel.description:
In case anyone is wondering, the black mesa music is beyond awesome... it deserves its own CD, it deserves its own thread. Right now all we have to enjoy is the little tidbits that have been released but to be honest, this IS enough to whet our appetites for months to come. Being the self proclaimed Joel Nielsen fan president, I just want to be sure that all who ask... receive.
Official website of Joel Nielsen: Music of Black Mesa: [COLOR='Navy']https://www.joelnielsen.com/[/SIZE]
Be sure to check this on a somewhat regular basis, cuz this cat likes to upload songs without letting us all know.
:thumbs up: You rawk Joel!

item.title: Black Mesa Music
item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
^this

I have to say, Joel is doing an amazing job. I can’t wait to play the game and roam down the corridors with my trusty cowbar while jamming to his awesome tunes.

item.title: Black Mesa Music
item.dc:creator: Cellander
item.description:
raw_bean:

Indeed. DeBeerGuy rocks.

Actually I thought it was the real G-man voice sample taken from the game but modded to fit the trailer. Until yesterday when I read the discussion about it. Black Mesa have really talented voice actors.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Music
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
ChazFox:

I have to say I absolutely love the BMS theme. It’s perfect in almost every way, piano, orchestra, it just has this brilliant dark feeling to it. The only way in which it’s not perfect is that there’s not enough of it to go round! D:

Part of me kind of wishes there were an extended version of the song for additional awesome.

But yeah, loving the music! Keep up the awesome work Joel! Looking forward to Black Mesa and its music when it comes out

The versions of the BM songs available to download on the site are only samples of the full songs, not the full length.

Mr. Tissue Box:

Seriously? Wow, it sounds exactly like Valve’s. Bravo, voice actor!

Indeed. DeBeerGuy rocks.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Music
item.dc:creator: Mr_Tissue_Box
item.description:
Lamsey:

Listen to the trailer. That’s not Valve’s G-Man you’re hearing, it’s debeerguy (who also does the Barney voice, and gets it bloody perfect).

Seriously? Wow, it sounds exactly like Valve’s. Bravo, voice actor!

Read full topic

Ending credits > *

Especially the remixed version of HL2.

I know. It’s kind of like "This is the end of the mod. That’s it. It’s over. Go home. The problem is it’s lacking a feel of “Congratulations! You beat the mod! Now go play deathmatch.”

item.title: Black Mesa Music
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
It can only be reused if it’s distributed with Source’s Base Content… otherwise, using it in a freely downloadable project is copyright infringement.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Music
item.dc:creator: Disseminate
item.description:
DansonDelta40:

Love the music, but one quick question here:

My absolute favourite track of the original soundtrack was Song 15, which was reused in Half-Life 2 for the lighthouse battle and in Episode 2 for the opening recap. Will that be included in Black Mesa? Loved gunfighting to that music. :freeman: For me this is THE connecting Half-Life theme that reoccurs in every game - and HAS to reoccur. I just wanted to know if the complete soundtrack of Black Mesa will be new or if evergreens like this will also be used?

Indeed - this has to be my favorite song from the series.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Music
item.dc:creator: Lamsey
item.description:
I don’t think they can re-use the exact track, but Joel could certainly compose something inspired by it. I agree, however, that track just screams “Half-Life”.

Read full topic
